question_sentence: Widely shared social media posts say employers can’t mandate COVID-19 vaccines under federal law. This claim is:
What percentage of Americans say Donald Trump is the “true president” of the U.S., according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll?
Tuesday marked a year since George Floyd’s killing. The bill named after him has stalled in the Senate largely over this issue of:
choices: Creating a registry of police misconduct

question_sentence: Kristen Clarke was confirmed as the first Black woman to lead the DOJ’s civil rights division. How many Senate Republicans voted for her?
MLB’s Joe West set the record for most games as an umpire with:
A Florida high school faced major backlash after editing:
choices: Students’ yearbook photos to add clothing
Photos of a mural painted by students
Audio of the school’s alma mater during graduation

question_sentence: Phil Mickelson won the PGA Championship last weekend. By doing so, he set which record?
choices: Largest final day comeback in a major championship
Longest gap in between major championship victories
Lowest score in a major championship victory
Oldest golfer to win a major championship

question_sentence: John Cena apologized to China in Mandarin after:
Which one of these celestial events occured this week?
Author Eric Carle died this week at age 91. Which famous book did he write and illustrate?
The Ryanair plane forced to make an emergency landing in Belarus where a dissident journalist was detained was flying from Athens to which city?
Thieves broke into Arundel Castle and stole what £1m item of jewellery that belonged to Mary Queen of Scots?
Russia has deployed nuclear-capable bombers to which country in an effort to extend its reach over the Mediterranean region?
The Queen has so far met how many US presidents during her 69-year reign
A marathon select committee saw former No. 10 adviser Dominic Cummings answer questions on the government’s pandemic response for how long?
What is the name of the institute at the heart of the theory that the coronavirus leaked from a laboratory in Wuhan, China?
choices: Wuhan Public Health Centre for Virology

question_sentence: A species of what animal previously thought to have gone extinct has been discovered by researchers on the Galapagos Islands?
Amazon has agreed a deal to buy which Hollywood studio that is home to the James Bond, Rocky and Tomb Raider franchises?
What is the name of the Belarusian dictator who threatened to ‘flood the EU with drugs and migrants’ if sanctions are introduced following the Ryanair 'hijacking’?
The UK’s first rehabilitation centre for sufferers of long Covid has opened its doors in which city?
The White House announced that President Joe Biden will meet with which other world leader at a high-stakes summit next month in Switzerland?
choices: Boris Jonson of the United Kingdom
evidence: Biden is set to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin next month. This will be the first face-to-face meeting between the two leaders.

question_sentence: Which country is now facing fierce international backlash after its President was accused of forcing the re-routing of a Ryanair jet carrying a leading opposition activist?
evidence: President Alexander Lukashenko of Belarus ordered a fighter jet to escort the plane and land in Belarus, subsequently arresting opposition activist Raman Pratasevich.

question_sentence: Golfer Phil Mickelson just became the oldest winner of a major tournament with his victory at the 2021 PGA Championship. How old was he when he won?
evidence: Mickelson took the title at 50 years of age, surpassing the record formerly held by Julius Boros who won the PGA Championship in 1968 at age 48.

question_sentence: As the nation commemorated the one-year anniversary of George Floyd’s death, a major police reform bill stalled in Congress, with legislators debating the concept of qualified immunity. What does this legal provision do?
choices: it protects state and local officials, including police officers, from most personal liability while on the job
it allows police officers to refuse to testify in a court of law
it provides legal protection for officers who are fired because of their conduct
it bans the firing of state officials, including police officers, for certain offenses
evidence: Qualified immunity is a controversial federal doctrine that protects officers accused of violating the Constitution while on duty. The George Floyd Justice in Policing Act would end the provision for all local, state and federal law enforcement officers.

question_sentence: President Biden is asking intelligence agencies to spend 90 days doubling down on their efforts to investigate what event or phenomenon?
choices: a recent spate of UFO sightings
evidence: Following newly analyzed evidence that the coronavirus may have leaked from a lab in Wuhan, Biden ordered intelligence agencies to further investigate and report back their findings.

question_sentence: This country’s transitional president and prime minister were removed this week by transitional vice president Assimi Goita. The move has reignited concerns about another coup in the country less than a year after a previous one.
evidence: Goita, forced the ousting of President Bah N’Daw and Prime Minister Moctar Ouane in Mali. Goita was also the one who led a coup in the country last year.

question_sentence: A Dutch court has handed down a landmark ruling to Royal Dutch Shell. What major undertaking has the court order the oil giant to complete by 2030?
choices: commit to serving only northern Europe
reduce CO2 emissions by almost half
double their manufacturing of wind turbines
evidence: The Dutch court’s decision, unprecedented in the oil industry, is forcing Royal Dutch Shell to cut its CO2 emissions by 45% by 2030 from 2019 levels.

question_sentence: Stargazers in some locations were able to witness a seasona supermoon coupled with a total lunar eclipse. What word is used to describe the May supermoon?
evidence: The latest lunar event is referred to as a “flower” supermoon, coinciding specifically with the blossoming of flowers in May in North America.

question_sentence: The Weeknd won big at the 2021 Billboard Music Awards, taking home awards across 10 different categories. In which category did he not win?
evidence: The Weeknd took all of the above except “top streaming songs artist,” which was won by Drake.

question_sentence: Which iconic YouTube video was auctioned off as a non-fungible token (NFT) for a stunning $760,999?
evidence: The 2007 YouTube classic “Charlie Bit My Finger” – featuring beloved baby Charlie biting his older brother’s finger – was auctioned off as an NFT, just one of thousands of digital assets that are now being sold online as cryptocurrency becomes more mainstream.
